channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: You Can Boost Your Longevity and Health in 20 Minutes a Week, Experts Say. But There’s a Catch
item.description: Even 5-10 minutes a few times a week can work.

item.title: Why most corporate and tech chiefs are saying the bare minimum about events in Minneapolis
item.description: CEO silence about Minneapolis, one leader says, “isn’t neutral. It’s expensive. Letting this chaos continue is fiscal malpractice.”

item.title: Trump’s plan to make housing affordable is faltering
item.description: “We’re not going to destroy the value of their homes so somebody who didn’t work very hard can buy a home,” Trump said.

item.title: Goldman Sachs leads $75 million funding round for Fieldguide, an AI-native accounting and audit platform
item.description: Valued at $700 million, Fieldguide is combating the ‘existential’ talent crisis for the CPA industry.

item.title: 30 years after the founding of ‘Silicon Alley,’ New York’s tech scene is so big it has no center
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: How HR’s 2026 to-do list will change your workplace
item.description: The era of the empowered worker is behind us, at least for now. The last year has seen a stark reversal of the dynamics that were at play in the after...

item.title: Elon Musk Fails to Deliver on His Cybercab and Optimus Promises—Again
item.description: The Tesla CEO says production on the company’s robotaxis and humanoid robots will be ‘agonizingly slow’ in 2026.

item.title: 4 Personality Traits That Show You’re More Emotionally Intelligent Than You Think, Backed by Science
item.description: For example, disliking making small talk can be a good thing.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s Boiled Down His Parenting Advice to 1 Simple Sentence. Science Agrees
item.description: Warren Buffett’s parenting advice sounds folksy, but it’s actually backed by a ton of child development research.

item.title: Hospitals are 24/7 energy hogs. This one just went all electric
item.description: The University of California Irvine’s new healthcare campus has a long list of innovative features, from its combined inpatient-outpatient surgical su...

item.title: These business partners designed their dream bookstore. It took a lot of ‘manifesting’
item.description: For business partners Victoria Jackson and Jennifer Rudolph Walsh, their lives are intermingled with work. As cofounders of 15-month-old bookstore God...

item.title: Kennedy Center to close for 2 years for renovations after a wave of canceled shows due to Trump adding his name to the building
item.description: Trump announced the closure days after the premiere of “Melania” a documentary of the first lady was shown at the storied venue.

item.title: Singapore launches first space agency, joining a Southeast Asian race to tap a fast-growing space sector
item.description: The World Economic Forum predicts the global space economy to exceed $1.8 trillion by 2035, up from $613 billion in 2024.

item.title: Recruiters say job boards like LinkedIn are dead. Here’s how to hire instead
item.description: The best recruiter I know is going to spend the next three months hiring without posting to a single job board website, like Indeed or LinkedIn . “Lin...

item.title: Everything you need to know about NASA’s Artemis II mission, bringing humans back to the moon
item.description: It’s been more than half a century since astronauts last stepped onto the moon. Now, NASA’s Artemis II will return four humans to its vicinity in a 10...
